moves.14... Bxc2 15. Qe3 Kb8 16. Na2 d4 17. Qd: Black is trying to open lines for the attack on g2.
White threatens Rb4. The black bishop is out of place on a4. The next move is intended to frustrate this threat.
moves.32... Rd7 33. Be4 Rgd8 34. Nc3: The out of position bishop is threatened.  Black aims to prevent loss by posing threats in other areas.
moves.34... f5 35. Bc6: A good move. The position looks won for white here.
moves.35... Rf7 36. Nxa4 bxc6 37. bxc6+ Ka8 38: White has won a exchange but black has four pawns to two. Two of these pawns are on the sixth rank.
moves.49... a4 50. Kg3 a3 51. Kg4 Rb2 52. Rc1: Rxa2 was the move when the game ends in a rook endgame with an extra pawn to black.  This simply loses.
